messages.message:
@Anil Is there a reason why we exclude `redis` from `ppy start lite`? I usually do `ppy start lite` to start my dev env and find out that everything was super slow because redis is not running
https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/64229
After the change to where we started running RabbitMQ using brew, I tested running redis using brew and it worked fine.
One less service to compile and run.
How does this affect people on crafting? Should both redis and rabbitMQ be automatically started in Crafting? I still have to manually do `ppy start redis` and `ppy start rabbitMQ`.
It would be same as with rabbitmq.
Well but rabbitmq gets passed together with the crafting sandbox, redis does not?
let's add a redis container to the ibdev template, it's super easy to do and will expose a redis instance in your environment with the `redis` host name :slightly_smiling_face:

updated -- people can pick up the change by either syncing your sandbox template from the sandbox overview page, or by running `workspace update` -- you will need to modify the relevant `docker-env.json`  files to point to the new host (similar to rabbitmq), e.g. `"cache_host": "docker.for.mac.localhost"` would become `"cache_host": "redis",`
